column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The stern Hhetsarro has something both pointy and poignant for you to deliver.
Deliver the polished horn to the spirited Hhetsarro.
Obtain the fresh vegetables.
Deliver the fresh vegetables to the stern Hhetsarro.
Hail, traveler. If you're bound for Hhusatahwi, I have a favor to ask.
Could I get you to deliver this polished horn to my sister?
You'll find her tending the field on the outskirts of town. She shouldn't be hard to recognize─we have the same hair color.
Please make sure that polished horn gets to my sister in Hhusatahwi. Keep an eye out for a Hhetsarro farmer with the same color hair as me.
Oho, what can I do for you?
Ah, this horn... I knew the day would come, but it's sad to think he's no longer with us.
I appreciate the delivery, nonetheless! I hate to ask any more of you, but there's something I want to give to my sister in return.
Harvest a handful of vegetables from that plant and take them to her, would you?
I know I ought to do it myself, but the crops won't tend themselves... Anyway, tell her that I'll come and visit soon!
Did you deliver the horn?
Welcome back, traveler. Ah, but what is that you have there?
So fresh and plump... These look delicious. Clearly my sister's been hard at work.

I suppose you're wondering why I had you deliver that horn. It came from an old rroneek bull that recently passed away. He was our hhetso─one of many creatures we Hhetsarro seek guidance from throughout our lives.
My sister and I─our souls are bound together through that rroneek. So too in death, as much as in life.
One horn I gave to my sister, the other horn I keep with me. It struck me as a fitting symbol of the connection. I'm sure she understood.
She may have moved to Hhusatahwi, but she's still Hhetsarro. Nothing will ever change that.
Anyway, judging by your message, I can expect a visit from her any day now. I should prepare a feast to welcome her back home.
Thank you, traveler. We sisters were fortunate to have met you.
